column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Sr3OsO6 was synthesized under a high-pressure condition by solid-state reaction from powders of SrO2 (laboratory-made from 99.0% SrCl2∙6H2O, Wako Pure Chem. Co.),21 SrO (laboratory-made from 99.9% SrCO3, Wako Pure Chem. Co.), and OsO2 (laboratory-made from 99.95% Os, Nanjing Dongrui Platinum Co., Ltd.).
#Text=The powders were thoroughly mixed at the stoichiometric ratio 2SrO + SrO2 + OsO2, and then sealed in a Pt capsule.
#Text=The procedure was conducted in an Ar-filled glove box.

#Text=Under a pressure of 6 GPa, using a multi-anvil-type apparatus (CTF-MA1500P, C&T Factory Co., Ltd, Japan), the capsule was heated at 1200 °C for 30 min, after which the pressure was gradually released.
#Text=The obtained pellet was dense and black in color.
